treatment.description: Erect, 1 m. or more tall, with stout spreading or horizontal branches, the canes angled and bearing stoutish prickles; primocane-leaves 5-foliolate, with coarse jagged double toothing; terminal leaflet cordate-ovate, tapering gradually from base to apex; inflorescences with 2 or 3 long basal bracts, the several upper naked pedicels subtended by tiny bracts but equaled or overtopped by the lower foliaceous ones; flowers 3-4 cm. broad; fruit 1.2-1.5 cm. in diameter.
